chargeHist.descr: Maintain Drug Trafficking Place (939.05 Party to a Crime)(939.63(1)(b) Use of a Dangerous Weapon)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher Joel Berry was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).
  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place [Modifiers: Party to a Crime, Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to CT 2 and to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
AS TO BOTH COUNTS:
Successfully complete a Parenting Class. Successfully complete a Cognitive Behavior Program.

Absolute Sobriety, no alcohol. Defendant NOT to possess or use any controlled substances unless by valid prescription. No use or possession of illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. No contact with Joshua B. or Javod P.  Defendant may not possess more than $200.00 in cash at any time.
Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including drug and alcohol testing.
Seek and maintain full time work, school or a combination of both.
No possession of any firearm or weapon, ammunition. Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession; Voting.

supervisions.notes: BOTH COUNTS: Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

AS TO BOTH COUNTS: Provide DNA sample (unless previously submitted) and pay surcharge.
Court costs, fines, surcharges to be paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). If not paid in full at the end of the initial confinement the remaining balance will be entered as a civil judgment.
Consecutive to CT 1 and to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Court prohibits contact with Joshua B. (4/27/1981) and Javod P (2/25/1986).

records.addlTxt:
AS TO COUNT 1 AND 2 of the Amended Information- 
The defendant was advised of his/her constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Defendant Christopher Joel Berry in court with attorney Amber K. Rumpf.  Defendant Christopher Joel Berry in custody.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.
Defendant is charged as follows: 
Count 1 Possession of a Firearm by A Felon, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes sections 941.29 (2)(a), 939,50 (3)(g) a Class G Felony 
Count 2 Keeping a Drug House - PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Second and Subsequent Offense, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes sections 961.42(1), 939.50 (3)(i), 939.05, 961.48(1) (b) a Class I Felony.

Attorney Amber K. Rumpf in court. Defendant, Christopher Joel Berry is in custody.  Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense requests case be set for Plea and Sentencing. Court orders case adjourned for Plea and Sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 7, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Christopher Joel Berry in court with attorney Amber K Rumpf.  Defendant Christopher Joel Berry in custody.  Karl P Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State:  Agent Daniel Isaacson, DOC., Officer William Esqueda,  MPD.  Parties rest.  
 Testimony closed.  Closing arguments made by the State and defense.  Based on all filings, testimony and evidence in court, the court  finds that there was probable cause for the search and seizure therefore they were legal.  Therefore, the court DENIED defense motion to suppress.  Parties advised effective 8-3-14, case will be assigned to Judge Stark, Br. 17, in room 313 of the Safety Building.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 5, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Motion hearing scheduled for August 7, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for August 18, 2014 at 09:00 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FROM DODGE FOR PURPOSES OF THE PROJECTED GUILTY PLEA IN BRANCH 26.

Defendant Christopher Joel Berry in court with attorney Amber K Rumpf.  Defendant Christopher Joel Berry in custody.  Karl P Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Also present in court is attorney Stephen A. Sargent, and the co-defendant Joshua Java Berry. Sworn for the State: 1). Officer Martez Ball (MPD).  Exhibit 1 (Diagram) offered, marked, and received into evidence.  Cross-Examination by Defense, Amber Rumpf, and attorney Stephen A. Sargent. Court adjourned case for a Continuation of the Motion to Suppress. Motion hearing scheduled for June 19, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
State's Notice of Motion and Motion to Adjourn Hearing received and filed with court.
State's Response To Defendant's Motion To Suppress Evidence received and filed with court.
Filed by the Defense:  Notice of Motion and Motion to Suppress Evidence.

Attorney Amber Kay Rumpf in court, defendant Christopher Joel Berry not in court, in custody.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion hearing scheduled for May 8, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Original Transcript PRELIMINARY HEARING  (32 pages) commencing  FEBRUARY 5, 2014  received and filed.

Defendant Christopher Joel Berry in court with attorney Amber Rumpf.  Defendant Christopher Joel Berry in custody.  Karl P Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Case heard for Br. 26.  Defense acknowledges receipt of a copy of the Information, waives reading and enters a plea of not guilty.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Transcript commenced on 02-05-2014 PRELIMINARY HEARING received and filed.  Original transcript in case file 14CF000090 (32 Pages).
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Defense request to modify the NO CONTACT ORDER is denied.

Defendant Christopher Joel Berry in court with attorney Amber Rumpf.  Defendant Christopher Joel Berry in custody.  Karl P Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took judical notice of certified documents regarding case #05CF2411 that are attached to the complaint.  Sworn for the state:Daniel Issacson-WI DOC Probation Supervisor.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Case is adjourned to Branch 26.  Arraignment scheduled for February 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Filed, Notice of Motion and Motion for Bail Modification.
ADJOURNMENT
Defendant waived time limits for Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Christopher Joel Berry in court with attorney Amber Rumpf.  Defendant Christopher Joel Berry in custody.  Karl P Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defense counsel waives the appearance of the defendant for today's proceedings.  State was prepared to commence the Preliminary Hearing today.  Both parties agree to an adjournment so that an officer be present to testify at the next scheduled court date.  Court ordered case adjourned for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 5, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with CO-DEFENDANT, JOSHUA BERRY AND MARIANA H.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Christopher Joel Berry in court with attorney Vincent Guimont.  Defendant Christopher Joel Berry in custody.  Jennifer L. Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge POCAN, Branch 26.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
